title: Getting Started with medsim
text: medsim provides standardized infrastructure conducting Monte Carlo simulation studies mediation analysis. vignette demonstrates basic workflow running simulation study.

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("data-wise/medsim")

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: Create function takes simulated data parameters, returns estimates: Choose execution mode based needs: Use built-standard mediation scenarios:
code: library(medsim)  my_method <- function(data, params) {   # Fit mediation models   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)      # Extract path coefficients   a <- coef(fit_m)["X"]   b <- coef(fit_y)["M"]      # Return results   list(     indirect = a * b,     a_path = a,     b_path = b   ) } # Quick validation (~30 seconds) config_test <- medsim_config("test")  # Development (~15 minutes) config_local <- medsim_config("local")  # Production (hours, for HPC clusters) config_cluster <- medsim_config("cluster") scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  # View available scenarios names(scenarios) #> [1] "Independent Paths"   "Moderate Correlation" #> [3] "High Correlation"    "Suppression" #> [5] "Non-zero Effects"    "Unequal Variances" results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = medsim_config("test")  # Use "local" for real studies ) # Summary statistics summary(results)  # Detailed analysis analysis <- medsim_analyze(results) print(analysis)

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: Create function takes simulated data parameters, returns estimates:
code: library(medsim)  my_method <- function(data, params) {   # Fit mediation models   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)      # Extract path coefficients   a <- coef(fit_m)["X"]   b <- coef(fit_y)["M"]      # Return results   list(     indirect = a * b,     a_path = a,     b_path = b   ) }

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: Choose execution mode based needs:
code: # Quick validation (~30 seconds) config_test <- medsim_config("test")  # Development (~15 minutes) config_local <- medsim_config("local")  # Production (hours, for HPC clusters) config_cluster <- medsim_config("cluster")

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: Use built-standard mediation scenarios:
code: scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  # View available scenarios names(scenarios) #> [1] "Independent Paths"   "Moderate Correlation" #> [3] "High Correlation"    "Suppression" #> [5] "Non-zero Effects"    "Unequal Variances"

title: Getting Started with medsim
code: results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = medsim_config("test")  # Use "local" for real studies )

title: Getting Started with medsim
code: # Summary statistics summary(results)  # Detailed analysis analysis <- medsim_analyze(results) print(analysis)

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: Define simulation scenarios:
code: my_scenario <- medsim_scenario(   name = "Large Effects",   description = "Both paths have large effects",   data_generator = function(n = 200) {     X <- rnorm(n)     M <- 0.7 * X + rnorm(n)     Y <- 0.7 * M + rnorm(n)     data.frame(X = X, M = M, Y = Y)   },   params = list(     a = 0.7,     b = 0.7,     indirect = 0.49   ) )  # Combine with standard scenarios all_scenarios <- c(medsim_scenarios_mediation(), list(my_scenario))

title: Getting Started with medsim
text: medsim automatically detects HPC environments:
code: # Auto-detect environment config <- medsim_config(mode = "auto")  # Check detected environment medsim_detect_environment()

what: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: medsim provides standardized infrastructure conducting Monte Carlo simulation studies mediation analysis. Eliminate need repeatedly implement parallel processing, progress reporting, result analysis, visualization across different research projects.

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Environment-Aware Execution: Automatically detects local machine vs HPC cluster Three Execution Modes: test (~30s), local (~15min), cluster (hours) Parallel Processing: Built-parallelization progress bars Ground Truth Caching: Avoid expensive recomputation Automated Analysis: Summary statistics, accuracy metrics, coverage rates Publication-Ready Output: Figures LaTeX tables one function call

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: medsim part mediationverse ecosystem mediation analysis R: See Ecosystem Coordination version compatibility development guidelines.

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("data-wise/medsim")

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Output: Complete simulation results figures tables results/
code: library(medsim)  # 1. Define your estimation method my_method <- function(data, params) {   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)    a <- coef(fit_m)["X"]   b <- coef(fit_y)["M"]    list(indirect = a * b, a = a, b = b) }  # 2. Configure and run simulation config <- medsim_config("local") scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = config )  # 3. Generate analysis and output medsim_workflow(results, output_dir = "results")

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Three modes optimized different use cases:
code: # Auto-detect environment config <- medsim_config(mode = "auto")  # Or specify explicitly config_test <- medsim_config(mode = "test")      # Quick check config_local <- medsim_config(mode = "local")    # Development config_cluster <- medsim_config(mode = "cluster")  # Production

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Six standard mediation scenarios covering common data-generating patterns:
code: scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  # 1. Independent paths (ρ = 0) # 2. Moderate correlation (ρ = 0.3) # 3. High correlation (ρ = 0.7) # 4. Suppression (mixed signs) # 5. Non-zero direct effect # 6. Unequal variances  # View scenario details print(scenarios[[1]])  # Generate data from a scenario data <- scenarios[[1]]$data_generator(n = 200)

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Define custom data-generating processes:
code: my_scenario <- medsim_scenario(   name = "Large Effects",   description = "Both paths have large effects (a = b = 0.7)",   data_generator = function(n = 200) {     X <- rnorm(n)     M <- 0.7 * X + rnorm(n)     Y <- 0.7 * M + rnorm(n)     data.frame(X = X, M = M, Y = Y)   },   params = list(     a = 0.7,     b = 0.7,     indirect = 0.49   ) )  # Combine with standard scenarios all_scenarios <- c(medsim_scenarios_mediation(), list(my_scenario))

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Full pipeline simulation manuscript-ready output: Generates: - Summary statistics accuracy metrics - Publication-ready PDF figures - LaTeX tables ready manuscript inclusion
code: # Run simulation results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = medsim_config("local") )  # Analyze results analysis <- medsim_analyze(results) coverage <- medsim_analyze_coverage(results) power <- medsim_analyze_power(results)  # Create publication-ready figures medsim_plot_coverage(coverage, output_file = "figures/coverage.pdf") medsim_plot_error_boxplot(results, output_file = "figures/errors.pdf")  # Generate LaTeX tables medsim_tables_workflow(results, output_dir = "tables")

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Automatic detection SLURM, PBS, LSF job schedulers:
code: #!/bin/bash #SBATCH --job-name=medsim #SBATCH --nodes=1 #SBATCH --cpus-per-task=20 #SBATCH --time=24:00:00  module load R/4.3.0 Rscript run_simulation.R # run_simulation.R library(medsim)  # Auto-detects cluster and uses all allocated cores config <- medsim_config(mode = "auto")  results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = config )

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Designed work seamlessly mediationverse packages:
code: library(medsim) library(medfit) library(probmed)  # Simulate P_med coverage pmed_method <- function(data, params) {   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)    med_data <- medfit::extract_mediation(     fit_m, model_y = fit_y,     treatment = "X", mediator = "M"   )    p_med <- probmed::compute_pmed(med_data)    # Bootstrap CI   boot <- medfit::bootstrap_mediation(     med_data,     statistic = probmed::compute_pmed,     n_boot = 1000   )    list(     estimate = p_med,     ci_lower = boot@ci_lower,     ci_upper = boot@ci_upper,     truth = params$true_pmed   ) }  results <- medsim_run(pmed_method, scenarios, config) coverage <- medsim_analyze_coverage(results)

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Compare performance across different estimation approaches:
code: methods <- list(   pmed = function(data, params) {     # Compute P_med with bootstrap CI   },    dop = function(data, params) {     # Distribution of Product CI   },    bounds = function(data, params) {     # Sensitivity analysis bounds   } )  results <- medsim_compare_methods(   methods = methods,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = config )  # Generate comparison table medsim_comparison_table(results) #>           Accuracy  Coverage  Power  Runtime #> P_med     0.95      0.948     0.82   3.2s #> DOP CI    0.94      0.952     0.81   0.1s #> Bounds    0.93      0.945     0.78   1.5s

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis
text: Inspired simulation infrastructure successful R packages academic projects: Configuration Repetition: Write simulation logic , run multiple modes Environment Awareness: Seamlessly scale laptop HPC cluster Reproducibility Design: Automatic seed management, session tracking Publication Ready: One function generates manuscript-ready output

what: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: medsim provides standardized infrastructure conducting Monte Carlo simulation studies mediation analysis. package designed work seamlessly mediation analysis ecosystem.

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: Environment-aware execution: Automatically detects local vs HPC cluster Parallel processing: Built-parallelization progress reporting Three execution modes: test (<1 min), local (~15 min), cluster (hours) Ground truth caching: Avoid expensive recomputation Automated analysis: Generate summary statistics automatically Publication-ready output: Figures LaTeX tables one function

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: Configuration: medsim_config() - Create simulation configuration medsim_detect_environment() - Detect local vs cluster Scenarios: medsim_scenarios_mediation() - Standard mediation scenarios medsim_scenario() - Define custom scenario Execution: medsim_run() - Run simulation study medsim_run_parallel() - Parallel execution Analysis: medsim_analyze() - Analyze simulation results medsim_analyze_coverage() - Analyze coverage rates medsim_analyze_power() - Analyze statistical power medsim_table_accuracy() - Create accuracy tables medsim_plot_error_boxplot() - Generate error boxplots

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: Basic simulation workflow:
code: library(medsim)  # Define your method my_method <- function(data, params) {   # ... your implementation ...   list(estimate = ..., se = ...) }  # Configure and run config <- medsim_config("local") scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = config )  # Analyze results analysis <- medsim_analyze(results)

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: Three modes different use cases:

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: medsim designed work : medfit: Model infrastructure extraction probmed: Probabilistic effect size (P_med) RMediation: Confidence intervals (DOP, MBCO, MC) medrobust: Sensitivity analysis

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: Getting Started: vignette("getting-started", package = "medsim") Custom Scenarios: vignette("custom-scenarios", package = "medsim") HPC Clusters: vignette("parallel-computing", package = "medsim") GitHub: https://github.com/data-wise/medsim Website: https://data-wise.github.io/medsim/

title: medsim: Simulation Infrastructure for Mediation Analysis — medsim-package
text: Maintainer: Davood Tofighi dtofighi@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
text: Computes comprehensive accuracy metrics simulation results including bias, mean absolute error (MAE), root mean squared error (RMSE), relative efficiency.

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
code: medsim_analyze(results, metrics = "all", by_scenario = TRUE)

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
text: results medsim_results object medsim_run() metrics Character vector: metrics compute. Options: "bias": Mean estimation error "mae": Mean absolute error "rmse": Root mean squared error "median_ae": Median absolute error "max_ae": Maximum absolute error "relative_bias": Bias percentage truth "": Compute metrics (default) by_scenario Logical: Compute metrics separately scenario (default TRUE)

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
text: list class "medsim_analysis" containing: accuracy: data.frame accuracy metrics by_scenario: data.frame metrics scenario (by_scenario=TRUE) summary: Overall summary statistics

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
text: estimated parameter known ground truth: Bias: Mean estimation error (estimate - truth) MAE: Mean absolute error, robust outliers RMSE: Root mean squared error, penalizes large errors Median AE: Median absolute error, robust Max AE: Maximum absolute error, identifies worst case Relative Bias: Bias percentage true value

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
text: Bias close 0: unbiased estimator MAE/RMSE small: accurate estimator RMSE > MAE: presence outliers/large errors Relative bias: standardized bias metric

title: Analyze Simulation Results — medsim_analyze
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run simulation results <- medsim_run(method, scenarios, config)  # Analyze accuracy analysis <- medsim_analyze(results)  # View overall metrics print(analysis$accuracy)  # View by-scenario metrics print(analysis$by_scenario)  # Custom metrics analysis <- medsim_analyze(   results,   metrics = c("bias", "mae", "rmse"),   by_scenario = FALSE ) } # }

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
text: Computes coverage rates confidence intervals simulation results. Requires simulation method returns confidence interval bounds (e.g., ci_lower, ci_upper).

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
code: medsim_analyze_coverage(   results,   ci_levels = c(0.9, 0.95, 0.99),   ci_suffix = "_ci",   by_scenario = TRUE )

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
text: results medsim_results object medsim_run() ci_levels Numeric vector: nominal confidence levels check (default: c(0.90, 0.95, 0.99)) ci_suffix Character: suffix CI columns (default: "_ci") E.g., parameter "indirect", looks "indirect_ci_lower" "indirect_ci_upper" by_scenario Logical: Compute coverage separately scenario (default TRUE)

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
text: list class "medsim_coverage" containing: coverage: data.frame coverage rates by_scenario: data.frame coverage scenario (by_scenario=TRUE) summary: Overall summary statistics

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
text: Coverage rate proportion confidence intervals contain true parameter value. 95% CI, expect ~95% coverage large samples. Coverage < nominal: CI narrow (anti-conservative) Coverage ≈ nominal: CI correct width Coverage > nominal: CI wide (conservative)

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
text: function looks columns named: {parameter}_ci_lower {parameter}_ci_upper (default) custom suffix: {parameter}{ci_suffix}_lower {parameter}{ci_suffix}_upper

title: Analyze Coverage Rates — medsim_analyze_coverage
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Method that returns CIs my_method <- function(data, params) {   # ... estimation   list(     indirect = estimate,     indirect_ci_lower = ci[1],     indirect_ci_upper = ci[2]   ) }  results <- medsim_run(my_method, scenarios, config)  # Analyze coverage coverage <- medsim_analyze_coverage(results)  print(coverage$coverage) #>   parameter  coverage_90  coverage_95  coverage_99 #>   indirect   0.902        0.951        0.991 } # }

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
text: Computes empirical power (rejection rate alternative hypothesis) simulation results. Requires simulation method returns p-values.

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
code: medsim_analyze_power(   results,   alpha = 0.05,   p_suffix = "_p",   null_value = 0,   by_scenario = TRUE )

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
text: results medsim_results object medsim_run() alpha Numeric: significance level (default: 0.05) p_suffix Character: suffix p-value columns (default: "_p") E.g., parameter "indirect", looks "indirect_p" null_value Numeric: null hypothesis value (default: 0) by_scenario Logical: Compute power separately scenario (default TRUE)

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
text: list class "medsim_power" containing: power: data.frame power rates by_scenario: data.frame power scenario (by_scenario=TRUE) summary: Overall summary statistics

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
text: Power probability correctly rejecting null hypothesis false (.e., detecting true effect). Power = proportion replications p < alpha Higher power = better ability detect effects Power depends : effect size, sample size, alpha level

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
text: function computes empirical power simulations, theoretical power. scenarios null true (e.g., indirect effect = 0), rejection rate represents Type error rate, power.

title: Analyze Statistical Power — medsim_analyze_power
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Method that returns p-values my_method <- function(data, params) {   # ... estimation and testing   list(     indirect = estimate,     indirect_p = p_value   ) }  results <- medsim_run(my_method, scenarios, config)  # Analyze power power <- medsim_analyze_power(results, alpha = 0.05)  print(power$power) #>   parameter  power    n_valid #>   indirect   0.847    1000 } # }

title: Clear Cache — medsim_cache_clear
text: Deletes cache files directory. Can delete files files matching pattern.

title: Clear Cache — medsim_cache_clear
code: medsim_cache_clear(   cache_dir,   pattern = "*.rds",   max_age = NULL,   confirm = TRUE )

title: Clear Cache — medsim_cache_clear
text: cache_dir Character: Directory containing cache files pattern Character: Optional pattern match files (e.g., "truth_*.rds") max_age Numeric: Delete files older many days. NULL, deletes matching files. confirm Logical: Ask confirmation deleting (default TRUE)

title: Clear Cache — medsim_cache_clear
text: Invisibly returns number files deleted

title: Clear Cache — medsim_cache_clear
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cache medsim_cache_clear("cache")  # Clear old cache only medsim_cache_clear("cache", max_age = 30)  # Clear specific pattern medsim_cache_clear("cache", pattern = "truth_*.rds")  # Without confirmation medsim_cache_clear("cache", confirm = FALSE) } # }

title: Check if Cache Exists — medsim_cache_exists
text: Checks cache file exists readable.

title: Check if Cache Exists — medsim_cache_exists
code: medsim_cache_exists(file)

title: Check if Cache Exists — medsim_cache_exists
text: file Character: Path cache file

title: Check if Cache Exists — medsim_cache_exists
text: Logical: TRUE cache exists readable, FALSE otherwise

title: Check if Cache Exists — medsim_cache_exists
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ if (medsim_cache_exists("cache/truth.rds")) {   truth <- medsim_cache_load("cache/truth.rds") } else {   truth <- list(indirect = 0.09)  # Compute your truth values   medsim_cache_save(truth, "cache/truth.rds") } } # }

title: Get Cache Info — medsim_cache_info
text: Retrieves metadata cached object without loading full object.

title: Get Cache Info — medsim_cache_info
code: medsim_cache_info(file)

title: Get Cache Info — medsim_cache_info
text: file Character: Path cache file

title: Get Cache Info — medsim_cache_info
text: List cache metadata: exists: Logical - file exists size_mb: Numeric - file size MB modified: POSIXct - last modified time age_days: Numeric - age days timestamp: POSIXct - creation time (available) r_version: Character - R version used (available)

title: Get Cache Info — medsim_cache_info
code: info <- medsim_cache_info("cache/truth.rds") print(info) #> $exists #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $size_mb #> [1] NA #>  #> $modified #> [1] NA #>  #> $age_days #> [1] NA #>  #> $timestamp #> [1] NA #>  #> $r_version #> [1] NA #>

title: Initialize Cache Directory — medsim_cache_init
text: Creates cache directory proper structure README file explaining cache system.

title: Initialize Cache Directory — medsim_cache_init
code: medsim_cache_init(cache_dir, create_readme = TRUE)

title: Initialize Cache Directory — medsim_cache_init
text: cache_dir Character: Path cache directory create_readme Logical: Create README.md explaining cache (default TRUE)

title: Initialize Cache Directory — medsim_cache_init
text: Invisibly returns cache directory path

title: Initialize Cache Directory — medsim_cache_init
code: medsim_cache_init("cache") #> * Created cache directory: cache #> * Created README: cache/README.md medsim_cache_init("simulation_results/cache") #> * Created cache directory: simulation_results/cache #> * Created README: simulation_results/cache/README.md

title: List Cache Files — medsim_cache_list
text: Lists cache files directory metadata.

title: List Cache Files — medsim_cache_list
code: medsim_cache_list(cache_dir, pattern = "*.rds")

title: List Cache Files — medsim_cache_list
text: cache_dir Character: Directory containing cache files pattern Character: Pattern match files (default "*.rds")

title: List Cache Files — medsim_cache_list
text: data.frame columns: file: File name path: Full path size_mb: Size MB age_days: Age days modified: Last modified time

title: List Cache Files — medsim_cache_list
code: # List all cache cache_list <- medsim_cache_list("cache") print(cache_list) #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows  # List specific pattern truth_cache <- medsim_cache_list("cache", pattern = "truth_*.rds")

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
text: Loads previously cached R object. Returns NULL cache file exist.

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
code: medsim_cache_load(file, check_expiry = FALSE, max_age = 30, verbose = TRUE)

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
text: file Character: Path cache file check_expiry Logical: Check cache expired (default FALSE) max_age Numeric: Maximum age cache days (default 30). used check_expiry = TRUE. verbose Logical: Print messages cache status (default TRUE)

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
text: Cached object file exists valid, NULL otherwise

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
text: loading, cache checked : File exists File readable Age within max_age (check_expiry = TRUE)

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
text: cache exist: Returns NULL (error) Calling code compute cache result Example pattern:
code: result <- medsim_cache_load("cache/truth.rds") if (is.null(result)) {   result <- expensive_computation()   medsim_cache_save(result, "cache/truth.rds") }

title: Load Object from Cache — medsim_cache_load
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load from cache truth <- medsim_cache_load("cache/truth_scenario1.rds")  if (is.null(truth)) {   # Cache miss - compute and cache   truth <- compute_expensive_truth()   medsim_cache_save(truth, "cache/truth_scenario1.rds") }  # Load with expiry check result <- medsim_cache_load(   "cache/old_result.rds",   check_expiry = TRUE,   max_age = 7  # 7 days ) } # }

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
text: Saves R object cache file later retrieval. Uses RDS format efficient storage compression.

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
code: medsim_cache_save(object, file, compress = TRUE, overwrite = TRUE)

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
text: object R object cache file Character: Path cache file. Parent directory created exist. compress Logical: Compress cached object (default TRUE). Can significantly reduce file size large objects. overwrite Logical: Overwrite existing cache file (default TRUE)

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
text: Invisibly returns file path

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
text: Cache files stored RDS format metadata: Original object Timestamp creation R version used Package version (available)

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
text: Recommended cache directory structure:
code: cache/ |-- truth_scenario_1.rds |-- truth_scenario_2.rds +-- ...

title: Save Object to Cache — medsim_cache_save
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Cache simulation truth truth <- compute_expensive_truth() medsim_cache_save(truth, "cache/truth_scenario1.rds")  # Cache with metadata result <- list(value = 42, timestamp = Sys.time()) medsim_cache_save(result, "cache/my_result.rds") } # }

title: Compare Multiple Configurations — medsim_compare_configs
text: Creates comparison table showing differences test, local, cluster configurations.

code: medsim_compare_configs()

title: Compare Multiple Configurations — medsim_compare_configs
text: data.frame configuration comparison

title: Compare Multiple Configurations — medsim_compare_configs
code: comparison <- medsim_compare_configs() print(comparison) #>          Parameter                    Test              Local #> 1     Replications                      20                100 #> 2            Cores                       4                  2 #> 3        Scenarios                    test                all #> 4 Output Directory simulation_results_test simulation_results #>              Cluster #> 1               1000 #> 2                  2 #> 3                all #> 4 simulation_results

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
text: Compares performance multiple estimation methods across scenarios. Combines results multiple simulation runs computes relative performance metrics.

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
code: medsim_compare_methods(..., metrics = "all")

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
text: ... Named medsim_results objects (e.g., method1 = results1, method2 = results2) metrics Character vector: comparison metrics compute. Options: "accuracy", "timing", "coverage", "" (default)

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
text: list class "medsim_comparison" containing: accuracy_comparison: data.frame comparing accuracy metrics timing_comparison: data.frame comparing timing coverage_comparison: data.frame comparing coverage (applicable) summary: Overall comparison summary

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
text: Accuracy: MAE, RMSE, bias across methods Timing: Mean/median execution time Coverage: CI coverage rates (CIs available) Relative Efficiency: Ratio MSE (lower = better)

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
text: results must: Use scenarios (matched name) Use configuration (n_replications, seed) ground truth available (accuracy comparison)

title: Compare Multiple Methods — medsim_compare_methods
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Run multiple methods results_proposed <- medsim_run(method_proposed, scenarios, config) results_delta <- medsim_run(method_delta, scenarios, config) results_boot <- medsim_run(method_boot, scenarios, config)  # Compare comparison <- medsim_compare_methods(   proposed = results_proposed,   delta = results_delta,   bootstrap = results_boot )  # View accuracy comparison print(comparison$accuracy_comparison)  # View timing comparison print(comparison$timing_comparison) } # }

what: Compute Ground Truth for All Scenarios — medsim_compute_all_truth

code: medsim_compute_all_truth(   scenarios,   truth_function,   config,   parallel = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Compute Ground Truth for All Scenarios — medsim_compute_all_truth
text: scenarios List scenario objects truth_function Function compute ground truth config Configuration object parallel Use parallel processing verbose Print progress messages

title: Compute Ground Truth for All Scenarios — medsim_compute_all_truth

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
text: Creates configuration object simulation studies. Automatically detects whether running local machine HPC cluster adjusts parameters accordingly.

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
code: medsim_config(   mode = "auto",   n_replications = NULL,   n_cores = NULL,   scenarios = NULL,   output_dir = NULL,   seed = 12345,   ... )

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
text: mode Character: "auto", "test", "local", "cluster" "auto": Detect based environment variables (SLURM, PBS, LSF) "test": Quick validation (~30 seconds) "local": Development local machine (~15 minutes) "cluster": Production HPC cluster (hours) n_replications Integer: Number Monte Carlo replications. NULL, uses mode defaults (test=20, local=100, cluster=1000) n_cores Integer: Number CPU cores parallel processing. NULL, auto-detects (cores - 2 local, SLURM_CPUS_PER_TASK cluster) scenarios Character: "" "test". Use "test" single challenging scenario development output_dir Character: Directory saving results seed Integer: Random seed reproducibility ... Additional custom parameters

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
text: list simulation configuration parameters

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
text: mode = "auto", checks : SLURM_JOB_ID (SLURM scheduler) PBS_JOBID (PBS/Torque scheduler) LSB_JOBID (LSF scheduler) found, uses "cluster" mode. Otherwise, uses "local" mode.

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
text: can add custom parameters via ...:
code: config <- medsim_config(   mode = "local",   n_bootstrap = 5000,   alpha = 0.05,   custom_param = "value" )

title: Create Simulation Configuration — medsim_config
code: # Auto-detect environment config <- medsim_config(mode = "auto") #> Auto-detected: LOCAL environment  # Explicit test mode for quick validation config_test <- medsim_config(mode = "test")  # Local mode with custom replications config_local <- medsim_config(   mode = "local",   n_replications = 500 )  # Cluster mode (auto-detects SLURM cores) config_cluster <- medsim_config(mode = "cluster")  # Custom parameters config_custom <- medsim_config(   mode = "local",   n_bootstrap = 1000,   ci_level = 0.95 )  # Print configuration print(config) #>  #> ======================================================== #>   LOCAL MODE #> ======================================================== #>  #> Simulation Parameters: #>   Replications:        100 #>   Scenarios:           all #>  #> Computing Resources: #>   Cores:               2 #>   Random Seed:         12345 #>  #> Output: #>   Directory:           simulation_results #>  #> ======================================================== #>

what: Detect Number of Available Cores — medsim_detect_cores
title: Detect Number of Available Cores — medsim_detect_cores
text: Detects number CPU cores available parallel processing. HPC clusters, uses scheduler-allocated cores. local machines, uses cores minus 2 avoid overwhelming system.

title: Detect Number of Available Cores — medsim_detect_cores
code: medsim_detect_cores()

title: Detect Number of Available Cores — medsim_detect_cores
text: Integer: Number cores use

title: Detect Number of Available Cores — medsim_detect_cores
text: clusters, checks : SLURM_CPUS_PER_TASK (SLURM) PBS_NUM_PPN (PBS/Torque) LSB_DJOB_NUMPROC (LSF) local machines, uses parallel::detectCores() - 2.

title: Detect Number of Available Cores — medsim_detect_cores
code: n_cores <- medsim_detect_cores() message(sprintf("Using %d cores", n_cores)) #> Using 2 cores

title: Detect Computing Environment — medsim_detect_environment
text: Detects whether code running local machine HPC cluster checking scheduler environment variables.

title: Detect Computing Environment — medsim_detect_environment
code: medsim_detect_environment()

title: Detect Computing Environment — medsim_detect_environment
text: Character: "local" "cluster"

title: Detect Computing Environment — medsim_detect_environment
text: Checks following environment variables: SLURM_JOB_ID (SLURM scheduler) PBS_JOBID (PBS/Torque scheduler) LSB_JOBID (LSF scheduler) found, returns "cluster". Otherwise, returns "local".

title: Detect Computing Environment — medsim_detect_environment
code: env <- medsim_detect_environment() if (env == "cluster") {   message("Running on HPC cluster") } else {   message("Running on local machine") } #> Running on local machine

title: Estimate Parallel Speedup — medsim_estimate_speedup
text: Estimates expected speedup parallel processing based number cores task characteristics.

title: Estimate Parallel Speedup — medsim_estimate_speedup
code: medsim_estimate_speedup(n_tasks, n_cores, overhead = 0.1)

title: Estimate Parallel Speedup — medsim_estimate_speedup
text: n_tasks Integer: Number tasks n_cores Integer: Number cores overhead Numeric: Overhead per core (default 0.1 = 10%)

title: Estimate Parallel Speedup — medsim_estimate_speedup
text: Named list : speedup: Expected speedup factor efficiency: Parallel efficiency (0-1) recommendation: Character recommendation

title: Estimate Parallel Speedup — medsim_estimate_speedup
text: Speedup estimated using Amdahl's law overhead: Speedup = n_cores / (1 + overhead * n_cores) Efficiency = Speedup / n_cores

title: Estimate Parallel Speedup — medsim_estimate_speedup
code: # For 100 tasks on 10 cores est <- medsim_estimate_speedup(100, 10) cat(sprintf("Expected speedup: %.1fx\n", est$speedup)) #> Expected speedup: 5.0x cat(sprintf("Efficiency: %.0f%%\n", est$efficiency * 100)) #> Efficiency: 50%

what: Get Optimal Number of Cores — medsim_get_optimal_cores
title: Get Optimal Number of Cores — medsim_get_optimal_cores
text: Determines optimal number cores use parallel processing based system capabilities task requirements.

title: Get Optimal Number of Cores — medsim_get_optimal_cores
code: medsim_get_optimal_cores(n_tasks, reserve = 2, max_cores = NULL)

title: Get Optimal Number of Cores — medsim_get_optimal_cores
text: n_tasks Integer: Number tasks process. fewer tasks cores, returns n_tasks. reserve Integer: Number cores reserve system (default 2). applied local machines, clusters. max_cores Integer: Maximum number cores use. NULL, uses available (minus reserve).

title: Get Optimal Number of Cores — medsim_get_optimal_cores
text: Integer: Optimal number cores use

title: Get Optimal Number of Cores — medsim_get_optimal_cores
code: # For 100 tasks medsim_get_optimal_cores(n_tasks = 100) #> [1] 2  # For few tasks (returns n_tasks) medsim_get_optimal_cores(n_tasks = 3) #> [1] 2  # With maximum limit medsim_get_optimal_cores(n_tasks = 1000, max_cores = 8) #> [1] 2

text: results medsim_results object named list results objects panels Character vector: panels include. Options: "error", "timing", "coverage" (default: c("error", "timing")) layout Character: layout specification like "2x1", "1x2", "2x2" (default: auto-determined number panels) ... Additional arguments passed individual plotting functions

title: Create Combined Multi-Panel Figure — medsim_plot_combined_panel
text: combined plot object (patchwork gridExtra)

title: Create Combined Multi-Panel Figure — medsim_plot_combined_panel
text: Requires either patchwork gridExtra package combining plots.

title: Create Combined Multi-Panel Figure — medsim_plot_combined_panel
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Two-panel figure p <- medsim_plot_combined_panel(   results,   panels = c("error", "timing"),   layout = "1x2" )  # Four-panel figure for manuscript p <- medsim_plot_combined_panel(   list(Proposed = res1, Delta = res2),   panels = c("error", "timing", "coverage"),   layout = "2x2" ) } # }

Additional arguments passed ggplot2::theme()

title: Plot Coverage Rates — medsim_plot_coverage

title: Plot Error Distribution Boxplots — medsim_plot_error_boxplot
text: results medsim_results object medsim_run(), list named results objects method comparison parameter Character: parameter plot (default: "indirect"). NULL, plots parameters available ground truth. log_scale Logical: use log10 scale y-axis (default: FALSE) color_palette Character: color palette name RColorBrewer "viridis" (default: NULL uses ggplot2 defaults) title Character: plot title (default: auto-generated) ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::theme()

title: Plot Error Distribution Boxplots — medsim_plot_error_boxplot
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Error Distribution Boxplots — medsim_plot_error_boxplot
text: Box: IQR (25th 75th percentile) Line box: Median error Whiskers: 1.5 × IQR Points: Outliers beyond whiskers Tighter boxes = consistent estimates

title: Plot Error Distribution Boxplots — medsim_plot_error_boxplot
code: # Single method p <- medsim_plot_error_boxplot(results)  # Compare methods p <- medsim_plot_error_boxplot(list(   Proposed = results1,   Delta = results2,   Bootstrap = results3 ))  # Customize p <- medsim_plot_error_boxplot(   results,   log_scale = TRUE,   color_palette = "Set2" ) p + ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Plot Error Distribution Boxplots — medsim_plot_error_boxplot

Options: "mean", "median", "total" (default: "mean") log_scale Logical: use log10 scale y-axis (default: FALSE) title Character: plot title (default: auto-generated) ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::theme()

text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Timing Comparison — medsim_plot_timing

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
text: Executes complete simulation study running user-defined method across multiple scenarios replications. Supports parallel processing automatic result aggregation.

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
code: medsim_run(   method,   scenarios,   config,   compute_truth = NULL,   parallel = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
text: method Function: User-defined simulation method. Must accept two arguments: data (data.frame) params (list). return named list results. scenarios List scenario objects medsim_scenario() medsim_scenarios_mediation() config Configuration object medsim_config() compute_truth Function: Optional function compute ground truth. Takes arguments method. NULL, ground truth computed. parallel Logical: Use parallel processing (default TRUE) verbose Logical: Print progress messages (default TRUE)

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
text: medsim_results object (list) containing: results: data.frame simulation results summary: data.frame summary statistics truth: data.frame ground truth values (compute_truth provided) config: configuration used scenarios: scenarios used method_name: name method function timestamp: simulation run

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
text: method function must: Accept data (data.frame) first argument Accept params (list) second argument Return named list least one numeric element Example:
code: my_method <- function(data, params) {   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)    a <- coef(fit_m)["X"]   b <- coef(fit_y)["M"]    list(     indirect = a * b,     a_path = a,     b_path = b,     se_indirect = ...,  # Optional     ci_lower = ...,     # Optional     ci_upper = ...      # Optional   ) }

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
text: parallel = TRUE: Uses medsim_run_parallel() internally Number cores config$n_cores Progress bars shown (local) suppressed (cluster) necessary objects exported workers

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
text: compute_truth provided: Computed per scenario (cached automatically) Used calculate errors/bias results Can use Monte Carlo analytical methods

title: Run Simulation Study — medsim_run
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Define method my_method <- function(data, params) {   fit_m <- lm(M ~ X, data = data)   fit_y <- lm(Y ~ X + M, data = data)   list(indirect = coef(fit_m)["X"] * coef(fit_y)["M"]) }  # Configure and run config <- medsim_config("local") scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  results <- medsim_run(   method = my_method,   scenarios = scenarios,   config = config )  # View results print(results) summary(results) } # }

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: Executes list tasks parallel using multiple CPU cores. Provides progress bars, proper error handling, automatic cluster management.

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
code: medsim_run_parallel(   tasks,   fun,   n_cores = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   export = NULL,   packages = NULL,   cluster_type = NULL )

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: tasks Vector list: Tasks process (e.g., 1:100, list params) fun Function: Function apply task. accept one argument (task) return result. n_cores Integer: Number CPU cores use. NULL, uses available cores minus 2. progress Logical: Show progress bar (default TRUE). Automatically suppressed running cluster (batch jobs). export Character vector: Names objects export workers. objects must available calling environment. packages Character vector: Names packages load worker. Use fun requires specific packages. cluster_type Character: Type cluster ("PSOCK" "FORK"). FORK efficient works Unix. Auto-detected default.

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: List: Results applying fun task (length tasks)

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: PSOCK (default Windows): Creates separate R sessions. Requires explicit export objects packages. Works platforms. FORK (default Unix): Copies current R session. efficient, automatic object sharing, Unix-.

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: Progress bars shown interactive sessions local execution, suppressed HPC clusters avoid cluttering log files.

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: task fails: Error caught returned error object tasks continue processing Check results sapply(results, inherits, "error")

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
text: worker process requires memory. large tasks: Reduce n_cores running memory Process tasks chunks Use FORK cluster (Unix) shares memory

title: Run Tasks in Parallel — medsim_run_parallel
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Simple parallel computation results <- medsim_run_parallel(   tasks = 1:100,   fun = function(i) {     Sys.sleep(0.1)  # Simulate work     i^2   },   n_cores = 4 )  # With exports my_data <- data.frame(x = 1:10, y = 11:20)  results <- medsim_run_parallel(   tasks = 1:10,   fun = function(i) {     mean(my_data$x[1:i])   },   export = "my_data" )  # With packages results <- medsim_run_parallel(   tasks = 1:10,   fun = function(i) {     dplyr::tibble(x = i, y = i^2)   },   packages = "dplyr" )  # Check for errors errors <- sapply(results, inherits, "error") if (any(errors)) {   cat("Errors occurred in:", which(errors), "\n") } } # }

title: Run Tasks Sequentially — medsim_run_sequential
text: Runs tasks sequentially (parallelization). Used fallback parallel processing needed available.

title: Run Tasks Sequentially — medsim_run_sequential
code: medsim_run_sequential(tasks, fun, progress = TRUE)

title: Run Tasks Sequentially — medsim_run_sequential
text: tasks Vector list tasks fun Function apply task progress Show progress bar

title: Run Tasks Sequentially — medsim_run_sequential
text: List results

title: Run Single Simulation Replication — medsim_run_single_replication
text: Internal function run single replication simulation. called repeatedly medsim_run().

title: Run Single Simulation Replication — medsim_run_single_replication
code: medsim_run_single_replication(scenario, rep_id, method, config)

title: Run Single Simulation Replication — medsim_run_single_replication
text: scenario Scenario object rep_id Replication ID number method User-defined method function config Configuration object

title: Run Single Simulation Replication — medsim_run_single_replication
text: data.frame results replication

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
text: Define custom scenario simulation studies. scenario consists name, description, data generation function, population parameters.

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
code: medsim_scenario(name, description = "", data_generator, params = list())

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
text: name Character: Descriptive name scenario description Character: Detailed description (optional) data_generator Function: Takes n (sample size) returns data.frame params List: Known population parameters validation

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
text: scenario object (list class "medsim_scenario")

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
text: data_generator function must: Accept n (sample size) first argument Return data.frame least: X (treatment), M (mediator), Y (outcome) Can include additional variables covariates

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
text: params list include known population values: : X -> M path coefficient b: M -> Y path coefficient c_prime: X -> Y direct effect indirect: True indirect effect (* b) Additional parameters needed

title: Create Custom Simulation Scenario — medsim_scenario
code: # Simple custom scenario my_scenario <- medsim_scenario(   name = "Large Effects",   description = "Both paths have large effects",   data_generator = function(n = 200) {     X <- rnorm(n)     M <- 0.7 * X + rnorm(n)     Y <- 0.7 * M + rnorm(n)     data.frame(X = X, M = M, Y = Y)   },   params = list(     a = 0.7,     b = 0.7,     indirect = 0.49   ) )  # Generate data data <- my_scenario$data_generator(n = 100)  # Scenario with covariates covariate_scenario <- medsim_scenario(   name = "With Covariates",   data_generator = function(n = 200) {     C1 <- rnorm(n)     C2 <- rbinom(n, 1, 0.5)     X <- rnorm(n)     M <- 0.3 * X + 0.2 * C1 + rnorm(n)     Y <- 0.3 * M + 0.2 * C2 + rnorm(n)     data.frame(X = X, M = M, Y = Y, C1 = C1, C2 = C2)   },   params = list(     a = 0.3,     b = 0.3,     indirect = 0.09,     gamma_m = 0.2,     gamma_y = 0.2   ) )

title: Create Standard Mediation Scenarios — medsim_scenarios_mediation
text: Creates list standard mediation scenarios simulation studies. scenarios cover common patterns mediation analysis including independent paths, various correlation structures, suppression effects, non-standard conditions.

title: Create Standard Mediation Scenarios — medsim_scenarios_mediation
code: medsim_scenarios_mediation()

title: Create Standard Mediation Scenarios — medsim_scenarios_mediation
text: list scenario objects, name, description, data_generator function

title: Create Standard Mediation Scenarios — medsim_scenarios_mediation
text: Independent Paths: correlation X, M, Y Moderate Correlation: rho = 0.3 pairs High Correlation: rho = 0.7 pairs Suppression: Mixed positive negative correlations Non-zero Effects: Small moderate true effects Unequal Variances: Different residual variances scenario generates data : Sample size n (default: 200) Treatment X, Mediator M, Outcome Y Known population parameters validation

title: Create Standard Mediation Scenarios — medsim_scenarios_mediation
code: # Get all standard scenarios scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation()  # See scenario names sapply(scenarios, function(s) s$name) #> [1] "Independent"          "Moderate Correlation" "High Correlation"     #> [4] "Suppression"          "Non-zero Effects"     "Unequal Variances"     # Generate data from first scenario data <- scenarios[[1]]$data_generator(n = 100) head(data) #>            X          M          Y #> 1  0.4078885 -0.5756385 -0.1152698 #> 2  1.3939778 -1.4759325 -3.2507903 #> 3  0.3602783  0.1843827 -0.8569449 #> 4  0.6545503  1.0716736 -0.4608771 #> 5  1.0521554  0.7694740 -0.4332627 #> 6 -1.9795551 -1.4445834  0.1929347  # Access scenario parameters scenarios[[1]]$params #> $a #> [1] 0.3 #>  #> $b #> [1] 0.3 #>  #> $c_prime #> [1] 0 #>  #> $indirect #> [1] 0.09 #>  #> $rho_xm #> [1] 0 #>  #> $rho_my #> [1] 0 #>  #> $rho_xy #> [1] 0 #>

title: Setup Progress Bar Options — medsim_setup_progress
text: Configures pbapply package options progress bars. Automatically adjusts based execution environment (interactive vs batch).

title: Setup Progress Bar Options — medsim_setup_progress
code: medsim_setup_progress(style = NULL, char = "=")

title: Setup Progress Bar Options — medsim_setup_progress
text: style Character: Progress bar style ("timer", "txt", "none") char Character: Character use progress bar (default "=")

title: Setup Progress Bar Options — medsim_setup_progress
text: Invisibly returns previous options

title: Summarize Simulation Results — medsim_summarize_results
text: Computes summary statistics simulation results including mean, median, standard deviation, quantiles.

title: Summarize Simulation Results — medsim_summarize_results
code: medsim_summarize_results(results, by = "scenario")

title: Summarize Simulation Results — medsim_summarize_results
text: results data.frame simulation results Character vector: columns group (default: "scenario")

title: Summarize Simulation Results — medsim_summarize_results
text: data.frame summary statistics

title: Generate Accuracy Table — medsim_table_accuracy
text: Creates publication-ready LaTeX table showing accuracy metrics (bias, MAE, RMSE) simulation analysis results.

title: Generate Accuracy Table — medsim_table_accuracy
code: medsim_table_accuracy(   analysis,   digits = 3,   metrics = c("bias", "mae", "rmse"),   by_scenario = TRUE,   caption = NULL,   label = "tab:accuracy" )

title: Generate Accuracy Table — medsim_table_accuracy
text: analysis medsim_analysis object medsim_analyze() digits Integer: number decimal places (default: 3) metrics Character vector: metrics include. Options: "bias", "mae", "rmse", "median_ae", "max_ae", "relative_bias" (default: c("bias", "mae", "rmse")) by_scenario Logical: include scenario breakdown (default: TRUE) caption Character: table caption (default: auto-generated) label Character: LaTeX label cross-referencing (default: "tab:accuracy")

title: Generate Accuracy Table — medsim_table_accuracy
text: medsim_table object (character vector LaTeX code)

title: Generate Accuracy Table — medsim_table_accuracy
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ results <- medsim_run(method, scenarios, config) analysis <- medsim_analyze(results)  # Generate table table <- medsim_table_accuracy(analysis) print(table)  # Preview  # Write to file medsim_write_table(table, "tables/accuracy.tex") } # }

title: Generate Method Comparison Table — medsim_table_comparison
text: Creates publication-ready LaTeX table comparing multiple methods across accuracy, timing, coverage metrics.

title: Generate Method Comparison Table — medsim_table_comparison
code: medsim_table_comparison(   comparison,   metrics = c("accuracy", "timing"),   caption = NULL,   label = "tab:comparison" )

title: Generate Method Comparison Table — medsim_table_comparison
text: comparison medsim_comparison object medsim_compare_methods() metrics Character vector: metrics include ("accuracy", "timing", "coverage") caption Character: table caption label Character: LaTeX label

title: Generate Method Comparison Table — medsim_table_comparison
text: medsim_table object

title: Generate Coverage Table — medsim_table_coverage
text: Creates publication-ready LaTeX table showing confidence interval coverage rates.

title: Generate Coverage Table — medsim_table_coverage
code: medsim_table_coverage(   coverage,   expected = 0.95,   by_scenario = TRUE,   caption = NULL,   label = "tab:coverage" )

title: Generate Coverage Table — medsim_table_coverage
text: coverage medsim_coverage object medsim_analyze_coverage() expected Numeric: expected/nominal coverage rate (default: 0.95) by_scenario Logical: show coverage scenario (default: TRUE) caption Character: table caption label Character: LaTeX label

title: Generate Coverage Table — medsim_table_coverage
text: medsim_table object

title: Generate Power Table — medsim_table_power
text: Creates publication-ready LaTeX table showing empirical power (rejection rates) simulation analysis.

title: Generate Power Table — medsim_table_power
code: medsim_table_power(   power,   by_scenario = TRUE,   caption = NULL,   label = "tab:power" )

title: Generate Power Table — medsim_table_power
text: power medsim_power object medsim_analyze_power() by_scenario Logical: show power scenario (default: TRUE) caption Character: table caption label Character: LaTeX label

title: Generate Power Table — medsim_table_power
text: medsim_table object

title: Generate Timing Comparison Table — medsim_table_timing
text: Creates publication-ready LaTeX table comparing computational time across methods.

title: Generate Timing Comparison Table — medsim_table_timing
code: medsim_table_timing(   results_list,   metric = "mean",   include_speedup = TRUE,   reference_method = NULL,   by_scenario = FALSE,   caption = NULL,   label = "tab:timing" )

title: Generate Timing Comparison Table — medsim_table_timing
text: results_list Named list medsim_results objects, one per method metric Character: timing metric use ("mean", "median", "total") include_speedup Logical: include speedup column relative slowest method reference_method Character: method name use reference speedup (default: NULL uses slowest method) by_scenario Logical: show timing scenario (default: FALSE) caption Character: table caption label Character: LaTeX label

title: Generate Timing Comparison Table — medsim_table_timing
text: medsim_table object

title: Generate Timing Comparison Table — medsim_table_timing
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ table <- medsim_table_timing(list(   Proposed = results1,   Delta = results2,   Bootstrap = results3 )) } # }

title: Generate All Tables — medsim_tables_workflow
text: Convenience function generate tables simulation results save output directory.

title: Generate All Tables — medsim_tables_workflow
code: medsim_tables_workflow(   results,   output_dir,   tables = "all",   format = "latex",   prefix = "table_" )

title: Generate All Tables — medsim_tables_workflow
text: results medsim_results object medsim_run() output_dir Character: output directory tables tables Character vector: tables generate ("accuracy", "coverage", "power", "") format Character: output format ("latex", "csv", "markdown") prefix Character: prefix file names (default: "table_")

title: Generate All Tables — medsim_tables_workflow
text: Invisibly returns list generated file paths

title: Generate All Tables — medsim_tables_workflow
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ results <- medsim_run(method, scenarios, config)  # Generate all tables files <- medsim_tables_workflow(   results,   output_dir = "manuscript/tables",   format = "latex" ) } # }

title: Validate Scenario — medsim_validate_scenario
text: Checks scenario object valid can generate data correctly.

title: Validate Scenario — medsim_validate_scenario
code: medsim_validate_scenario(scenario, n = 10)

title: Validate Scenario — medsim_validate_scenario
text: scenario medsim_scenario object n Sample size test (default: 10)

title: Validate Scenario — medsim_validate_scenario
text: TRUE valid, throws error otherwise

title: Validate Scenario — medsim_validate_scenario
code: scenarios <- medsim_scenarios_mediation() medsim_validate_scenario(scenarios[[1]]) #> * Scenario 'Independent' is valid #> [1] TRUE

title: Write Table to File — medsim_write_table
text: Writes medsim_table object file LaTeX, CSV, Markdown format.

title: Write Table to File — medsim_write_table
code: medsim_write_table(table, file, format = NULL)

title: Write Table to File — medsim_write_table
text: table medsim_table object file Character: output file path format Character: output format ("latex", "csv", "markdown") NULL, inferred file extension.

title: Write Table to File — medsim_write_table
text: Invisibly returns file path

title: Write Table to File — medsim_write_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ table <- medsim_table_accuracy(analysis)  # Write LaTeX medsim_write_table(table, "tables/accuracy.tex")  # Write CSV medsim_write_table(table, "tables/accuracy.csv", format = "csv") } # }

title: medsim (development version)
text: Initial development release

title: medsim (development version)
text: medsim_config() environment-aware configuration (test/local/cluster modes) medsim_run() parallel simulation execution progress tracking medsim_scenario() defining custom simulation scenarios medsim_scenarios_mediation() standard mediation scenarios medsim_analyze() summarizing simulation results medsim_analyze_coverage() coverage rate computation medsim_compare_methods() multi-method comparison medsim_figures() publication-ready figure generation medsim_tables() LaTeX table generation medsim_workflow() - single function simulation manuscript-ready output Automatic SLURM/PBS/LSF environment detection Parallel processing automatic core detection Ground truth caching expensive computations

title: medsim (development version)
text: Comprehensive pkgdown website https://data-wise.github.io/medsim/ Vignettes getting started, custom scenarios, HPC usage

title: medsim (development version)
text: Part mediationverse ecosystem mediation analysis Designed test methods medfit, probmed, RMediation, medrobust Tested R 4.1.0+ See Ecosystem Coordination guidelines

title: medsim (development version)
text: 313+ tests passing GitHub Actions CI/CD multi-platform testing Codecov integration coverage tracking development version. Breaking changes may occur.
